doc.name: revCurrentRecordIsLast
doc.summary: Returns whether the current record is the last record in a record set (database cursor).

description.p: Use the revCurrentRecordIsLast function to stop when you reach the end of the records.
The recordSetID is the number returned by the revQueryDatabase function when the record set was created.
The revCurrentRecordIsLast function returns true if there are no more records, false otherwise.
If the operation is not successful, the revCurrentRecordIsLast function returns an error message that begins with the string "revdberr".

Important! The revCurrentRecordIsLast function is part of the Database library. To ensure that the function works in a standalone application, you must include this custom library when you create your standalone. In the Inclusions section of the General screen of the Standalone Application Settings window, make sure the "Database Support" checkbox is checked and the database drivers you are using are selected in the list of database drivers.
The revCurrentRecordIsLast synonym was added in version 2.0.
